segments.text: The woman seems so focused on that plate, like nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t noticed the water spilling all over the place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That boy is really stretching for those cookies, and the stool looks so wobbly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t fall and break something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting there, so patiently, like it’s totally normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets if it keeps going like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, like nothing is wrong inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just absurd.
segments.speaker: PAR
